bug.short_desc: create config.json template for legacy apps

long_desc.thetext: The 0.7 legacy apps will be migrated to use widgets from the qx.legacy.* name space. This name space will be moved to qooxdoo-contrib, under some suitable name (e.g. "qx07compat"). Legacy applications will need to download that contrib, so they will have the benefit of the migration. A pre-defined config.json shall be prepared for the inclusion of this contrib. This config can then be utilized during the create-application process.

The qx.legacy.* name space has been excluded from framework apiviewer (which was one of the concerns of leaving qx.legacy in the framework).
The extraction and subsequent downloading of the qx.legacy.* name space to and from qooxdoo-contrib can be done post 0.8-final.
-> moved to 0.8.1

There will only be a limited number of future 0.8+ releases that allow for the "hybrid" mode for migrating legacy apps. After that, migration should be done with the latest of these hybrid releases, but then following the regular migration between 0.8+ releases. The available hybrid releases are independent of the fact that the legacy code may be included from qooxdoo-contrib.

Not sure a config as described is needed (or even sufficient). The legacy part of the SDK doesn't only include the qx.legacy classes, but for instance the resources/qx/compat.
Wouldn't a contribution, that is also downloadable as a zip archive which extracts into a qooxdoo SDK folder, be sufficient or am I missing something? That would of course involve a manual step by the user for setting up the migration environment, but I guess that is ok given the many steps he/she has to make anyway. Thoughts?
Forking qx.legacy.* into contrib will not be supported. To Andreas.

resolved this bug as INVALID, since the legacy part (qx.legacy.* and resources/qx/compat for instance) was kept until and including 0.8.3 and then removed. See comment #2 for the strategy to migrate from a 0.7.x app into a "hybrid" release (latest being 0.8.3) if needed.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
